title: Integration user's password has expired
content:
UCMDB CIs are not syncing to Service Management, but Service Management CIs are syncing to UCMDB.

Cause

The issue occurs because the Service Management integration user's password has expired, preventing a successful connection to UCMDB.

Solution

Prerequisites

  1. Ensure you have the suite-admin user's password. You will need it to log in to the IdM Admin Portal and BO.
  2. Make sure the following password requirements are met:
  • Must be between 10 to 16 characters long
  • Must contain at least one uppercase letter
  • Must contain at least one lowercase letter
  • Must contain at least one numeric digit
  • Must contain at least one special character from the following set: , : / . _ ? & % = + - [ ] ( )

UCMDB deployment with IdM

Reset password

  1. Log in to IdM admin portal as suite-admin: https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin
  2. Select the organization with a name equal to the Tenant ID to which the integration user is assigned.
  3. On the left navigation pane, select Users.
  4. Select the integration user (the one used to log in to UCMDB).
  5. Scroll down and click Reset Password.
  6. Choose a new password and click Save.

Update Native SACM configuration settings

  1. Log in to the Suite Administration as suite-admin: https://<External_Access_Host>/bo
  2. Select the Tenants option.
  3. Select the Tenant to which the integration user is assigned.
  4. On the left navigation pane, select Application settings.
  5. Go to the Native SACM settings section.
  6. Update the UCMDB password.
  7. To verify the connection, click Test Connection. A pop-up message confirming a successful connection should appear.
  8. Click Save.
Log in again to Service Management.

UCMDB deployment without IdM

Reset password

  1. Log in to the UCMDB local client using an account with Server Administration privileges. Ensure that you select the customer whose ID matches the Service Management Tenant ID assigned to the integration user.
  2. Select the Security option in the bottom left.
  3. On the left navigation pane, select Users and Groups.
  4. Select the Users tab.
  5. Select the same user account that you used to log in to UCMDB.
  6. Click Change Password, then OK, after completing the required field.
  7. Click Save.
Update Native SACM configuration settings as described above, then log in again to SM.
